page.title: 07EGYPT POINT LIGHTHOUSE-COWES
page.content: The{Egypt Point Lighthouse}faces out across the Solent from a place half km west of the Royal Yacht Squadron.It has an iron frame and a copper roof and provides a navigational light.The water around the lighthouse is 13 or 14 metres deep and is not very dangerous.It is very small but contains a lot of eletrical equipment. The light is made up of 5 pairs of 250 watt bulbs which rotate and can be seen through the channel as far as Ryde.When a light fails another one is automatically positioned.A battery is kept on charge at all times in case there is a power cut.The lighthouse is the responsibility of Trinity House and a part-time attendant is employed to inspect it every day and to clean it when necessary,usually after a bad storm.
